title: How to Make a Constellation Jar

steps.headline: Find an appropriate jar.
steps.description: The jar should have a wide opening.

steps.headline: Find an aluminum sheet.
steps.description: You should be able to get one at a metal cutter or a hardware store.

steps.headline: Roll the aluminum sheet around the jar.
steps.description: Mark the aluminum sheet for later trimming - it should completely cover the jar.

steps.headline: Cut the aluminum sheet into size.
Obtain a constellation map or pattern.
steps.description: You could search online and have it printed.

steps.headline: Tape it on the surface of the aluminum sheet.
Start making holes.
steps.description:
Use the pattern as a guide in making your stars. Use different sizes of needle or drill bit. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Insert the aluminum sheet into the jar.
Obtain your lighting.
steps.description: You can use a tea light or any LED device that you can fit into the jar. Do not use real candles. The aluminium will melt and you will end up getting a melted star display.

steps.headline: Light it up at night and watch the stars in your room!

text:
Find an appropriate jar. The jar should have a wide opening. Find an aluminum sheet. You should be able to get one at a metal cutter or a hardware store. Roll the aluminum sheet around the jar. Mark the aluminum sheet for later trimming - it should completely cover the jar. Cut the aluminum sheet into size. Obtain a constellation map or pattern. You could search online and have it printed. Tape it on the surface of the aluminum sheet. Start making holes. Use the pattern as a guide in making your stars. Use different sizes of needle or drill bit. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Constellation-Jar-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Remove the paper pattern. Insert the aluminum sheet into the jar. Obtain your lighting. You can use a tea light or any LED device that you can fit into the jar. Do not use real candles. The aluminium will melt and you will end up getting a melted star display. Light it up at night and watch the stars in your room!
